item.title: Basic usage of PySimple GUI
item.description: [●Text body (41 pages in PDF format: 1.22MB)](http://www.k-techlabo.org/www_python/PySimpleGUI.pdf) Updated March 12, 2020 (→Mirror site DL) －－－－－－－－－－－－－－－－－－－ (2020/03/12) I teach programming at school. I made a text of PySimple GUI for use in educational settings. There are many GUI libraries for Python, but PySimpleGUI is probably the easiest for beginners. There is a sense of security that it is based on Tkinter. Although this text is still in a state of incompleteness, if it is used in the educational field, we will correct and update the content.

item.title: Draw a graph with PySimple GUI
item.description: # What you can do by reading this article With PySimple GUI, you can: You can draw bar graphs, line graphs, etc. Graph that refreshes display periodically For the basic operation of PySimpleGUI, please refer to If you use Tkinter, try using PySimpleGUI. Overview I think there are many people who analyze data as a way to use Python. Also, some people may want to visualize the results of analysis as line graphs or bar graphs.
